## Introduction

This page analyzes how life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population change over time for a single country in the Gapminder dataset.

## Load data

```{python}
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

gap = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")
gap.head()

country = "United States"
country_data = gap[gap["country"] == country].sort_values("year")

country_data[["country","year","life_expectancy","gdp_per_capita","population_millions"]].head()

years = country_data["year"]

plt.figure()
plt.plot(years, country_data["life_expectancy"], marker="o")
plt.title(f"Life Expectancy Over Time — {country}")
plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy")
plt.show()

plt.figure()
plt.plot(years, country_data["gdp_per_capita"], marker="o")
plt.title(f"GDP per Capita Over Time — {country}")
plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("GDP per Capita")
plt.show()

plt.figure()
plt.plot(years, country_data["population_millions"], marker="o")
plt.title(f"Population Over Time — {country}")
plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("Population (millions)")
plt.show()
```
